skill.name: paper-2-web
skill.description: This skill should be used when converting academic papers into promotional and presentation formats including interactive websites (Paper2Web), presentation videos (Paper2Video), and conference posters (Paper2Poster). Use this skill for tasks involving paper dissemination, conference preparation, creating explorable academic homepages, generating video abstracts, or producing print-ready posters from LaTeX or PDF sources.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill guiding users to use Paper2All toolchain externally. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the skill contains markdown documentation with bash command examples, not executable code. API keys are user-provided placeholders, URLs are legitimate dependency links, and there is no data exfiltration or malicious behavior.

low_findings.title: External API key configuration documentation
low_findings.description: The skill references API keys (OPENAI_API_KEY, GOOGLE_API_KEY) for user configuration via .env file. Placeholders are used, no hardcoded secrets.

low_findings.title: Shell command documentation
low_findings.description: The skill documents bash commands for installing and running the Paper2All toolchain. These are standard development operations.

content.user_title: Convert academic papers to websites, videos, and posters
content.value_statement: Transform academic papers into professional promotional materials for conferences and online sharing. This skill automates the creation of interactive websites, presentation videos, and conference posters from LaTeX or PDF sources.
actual_capabilities: Generate interactive academic homepages from LaTeX or PDF papers
Create professional conference posters with custom dimensions and branding
Produce presentation videos with narration, slides, and optional talking-head
Extract and highlight key findings for promotional content
Support batch processing for multiple papers
Integrate with OpenAI API for content generation
limitations: Video generation with talking-head requires NVIDIA A6000 GPU (48GB)
Complex mathematical equations may need manual review
Processing time varies from 15-120 minutes depending on components

use_cases.title: Conference preparation
use_cases.description: Generate posters and videos for upcoming academic conferences

use_cases.title: Preprint enhancement
use_cases.description: Create interactive websites to accompany bioRxiv or arXiv submissions

use_cases.title: Research promotion
use_cases.description: Transform published papers into promotional content for lab websites and social media

prompt_templates.title: Quick website
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert my LaTeX paper at [path] into an interactive academic homepage. Use GPT-4 and output to [output_dir].

prompt_templates.title: Conference poster
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 48x36 inch conference poster from my paper at [path]. Include institution branding and QR codes.

prompt_templates.title: Video abstract
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 5-minute video abstract from my research paper. Include slides, narration, and subtitles.

prompt_templates.title: Complete package
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate all promotional materials for my paper: website, poster (A0 size), and presentation video. Use logo search for branding.

output_examples.input: Convert my NeurIPS paper to a website for conference promotion
output: Sections: Abstract, Key Findings, Methods, Results, Conclusions
Links to paper, code repository, and data

output_examples.input: Create a conference poster for my ICML submission
output: 4x3 foot print-ready poster in PDF format
Key findings highlighted with professional color scheme
QR codes linking to paper and code

output_examples.input: Generate a video abstract for my Nature Communications paper
output: Subtitles in SRT and VTT formats

best_practices: Use LaTeX source with all assets (figures, bibliography) for best results
Enable logo search with Google API for professional branding
Generate website first (fastest) then poster and video for tight deadlines
Review all outputs for accuracy before finalizing
anti_patterns: Do not use scanned PDFs without selectable text
Avoid processing papers with missing figure files or broken references
Do not skip model selection - choose GPT-4 for production quality
Avoid generating videos without reviewing script and timing first

faq.question: What input formats are supported?
faq.answer: LaTeX source with main.tex and all assets (recommended), or high-quality PDF with selectable text.

faq.question: What are the hardware requirements?
faq.answer: 16GB RAM minimum, 32GB recommended. GPU optional for standard outputs, NVIDIA A6000 48GB required for talking-head video.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Combine with Paper2Video and Paper2Poster for complete packages. Outputs integrate with GitHub Pages, YouTube, and print services.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Data stays on your system. API keys are user-provided via .env file. No data is transmitted to the skill author.

faq.question: Why is my video generation failing?
faq.answer: Check LibreOffice and Poppler are installed. Verify 5GB+ disk space. For talking-head, confirm GPU has 48GB memory.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual creation?
faq.answer: Automates content extraction, layout design, and asset generation. Saves 4-8 hours per paper but requires review for accuracy.
